body_html:
So far I have been using the following to orthogonalize:

AA =tf.matmul(tf.transpose(A),A)
L = tf.cholesky(AA)
U = K.transpose(tf.matrix_solve(L,tf.transpose(A)))

This works well most of the time unless the matrix A is ill conditioned or not full rank. Do you have any suggestions for an alternative which will wont throw an exception when the matrix is not full rank?
body_text:
So far I have been using the following to orthogonalize:
AA =tf.matmul(tf.transpose(A),A)
L = tf.cholesky(AA)
U = K.transpose(tf.matrix_solve(L,tf.transpose(A)))

This works well most of the time unless the matrix A is ill conditioned or not full rank.  Do you have any suggestions for an alternative which will wont throw an exception when the matrix is not full rank?
body:
So far I have been using the following to orthogonalize:

    AA =tf.matmul(tf.transpose(A),A)
    L = tf.cholesky(AA)
    U = K.transpose(tf.matrix_solve(L,tf.transpose(A)))

This works well most of the time unless the matrix A is ill conditioned or not full rank.  Do you have any suggestions for an alternative which will wont throw an exception when the matrix is not full rank?
